did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Seneca, Lucius Annaeus, Spurious works. Manuscript (Ms 42)

address.addressline: Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: Philosophical texts on morality. Text in Latin. Codex Ms 42.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The manuscript is open for research.

prefercite.head: Citation
prefercite.p: When quoting material from this collection, the preferred citation is: Seneca, Lucius Annaeus, Spurious works. Manuscript, Codex Ms 42, Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center, University of Chicago Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope Note
scopecontent.p: Moral texts attributed (probably spuriously) to the stoic philosopher Seneca (ca. 4 BCE-65 CE): De quatuor virtutibus, De remediis fortuitorum, and Ex epistolis Senecae (which may be genuine). Bound in modern vellum. Text in Latin.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.persname: Seneca, Lucius Annaeus, approximately 4 B.C.-65 A.D.
